title: A Twitter thread on Russian Military supply logistics in Ukraine
Ask HN: How do you build a real startup, and not a feature?
text:
A few times, I've eagerly shown something I've put together to people and they respond with enthusiasm. Then, as soon as I show it to some "seasoned" people (I don't know them too well, just strictly professionally) they tell me that I'm just building a feature.

This always stings me, because I end up shelving the project. I've done this a few times in the past, and years later I still don't see the type of product I'd put together in the wild.

Can someone with startup experience tell me what people actually mean by "don't build a feature"? Thanks

title: Ask HN: How do you break up your day in WFH land?
text:
All the things they say on the internet are true about WFH. While massively helpful and it has truly allowed me to spend more time doing outside activities (like taking up Tennis), the monotony is fast setting in. I have tried moving locations, taking walking meetings, it just feels a lot of rote.

So HN - what do you do to break up your work day so every day is not a loop of the former?

Tell HN: A Reddit admin in the Bay Area is abusing their privileges
text:
Just a head's up since the Bay Area probably has the highest percentage of users here.

A reddit admin is abusing their privileges for their personal beliefs.

I found a post in the Bay Area subreddit from r/all. It was about people deflating tires on SUVs. I made two comments, copied below.

All new comments that I make in any sub (including ones that I've been subscribed to for a long time), no longer show up (shadowbanned), and when I click "Random" to discover a new sub, it always goes to r/femboymemes.

My username there is tempMonero123 in case anyone else wants to investigate. I did delete those two comments before I realized the scope of the situation, but I imagine anyone investigating can probably still see them (unless they really are deleted?).

> The wheel pressing down on a flat tire with the weight of a car, causes damage. The wheel has an edge that presses into the rubber when the tire is flat.

https://old.reddit.com/r/bayarea/comments/vt1a52/heads_up_about_the_tire_extinguishers_that_have/if61hwh/

> ^ Found the criminal.

https://old.reddit.com/r/bayarea/comments/vt1a52/heads_up_about_the_tire_extinguishers_that_have/if60ppw/
